divs: sighting detailsmy sister n law and i were driving down i75-s\85-s at night approx 11:00 on a saturday night (april 17, 2010). we were approaching "spagetti junction" in atlanta, i was doing about 60 mph. i slowed down without my sister in law even noticing that slowed down (because i noticed this unusal (what i thought was a plane at first) moving towards the left. by the time i said "lisa" look is that a plane (at this point-i was right in far left lane nearly completely stopped on 75-which is a very busy expressway!). when she looked up the object was about 20-25 feet above the hov lane. she said to me : " no thats not a plane, omg. we started to scream, cuss everything above!!! this thing stayed in one place, had multiple lights bulbs underneath (at least 15-20) very bright. it looked like it was swaying back and forth. now we also noticed that an actual plane which had already taken off from the airport (in the sky but miles away from this object), that only had about three lights and looked like a "bird". at that point we quickly compared the two and the object we saw was not a plane. as i proceeded to move the car (because my sister in law said go go, they're are cars coming behing you). we noticed that it tilted a little upwards as if it was about to fly off, this is when we noticed that color of it was gray or steel and that it had a round dome at the top of it. in a blink of an eye the damn thing flew away so quick, we said where in the world did it go? it actually was going in the same direction the plane that we saw, which was closer to the airport. (im sure that pilot saw that!!! it was only a few feet high from the top road on spagetti junction\ hov lane. all of this was in about 3 minutes...by the way we both had our cell phones in our laps and was too shocked, that we didnt realize to take any pictures :( but wonderful experience!!
trends: There have been 95 other sightings in Atlanta
There were no other sightings in Atlanta on or around April 17th 2010
Summary: Round, approx 15-20 lights underneath, gray color with dome.
